cli_could_not_create_dir: %(error_code)s - The directory '%(dir)s' could not be created.
cli_invalid_url_option: The specified API URL is not valid.
cli_invalid_path_option: Invalid options, path can only be used for web assets.
cli_help_on_commands: For help on specific commands use wchtools <command> -h
cli_update_notifier: A new version of wchtools exists. Run '%(update_command)s' to update from version %(current_version)s to version %(new_version)s.
cli_opt_verbose: Display verbose results from the specified operations.
cli_opt_url: The API URL specific to your %(product_name)s tenant. You can find this URL in the hub information dialog of the %(product_name)s authoring user interface.
cli_opt_invalid_dir: The specified directory %(dir)s could not be created.
cli_pull_complete_nothing_pulled: No items pulled, nothing modified on the server.  Use the -I option to ignore timestamps, if you want to pull unmodified server artifacts
cli_pull_complete_ignore_timestamps_noth: No items to be pulled. Pull complete
cli_pull_pulling_pages: Pulling page definitions for the specified site
cli_pull_description: Pull modified authoring artifacts from the IBM Watson Content Hub. By default if no artifact types are specified, web assets will be used as the default.
cli_pull_opt_types: If specified, content types will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_assets: If specified, content assets will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_web_assets: If specified, web assets will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_layouts: If specified, layouts will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_layout_mappings: If specified, layout mappings will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_image_profiles: If specified, image profiles will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_content: If specified, content will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_renditions: If specified, renditions will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_categories: If specified, categories will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_profiles: If specified, publishing profiles will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_site_revisions: If specified, publishing site revisions will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_sources: If specified, publishing sources will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_sites: If specified, site definitions will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_pages: If specified, page definitions for the specified site will be pulled.
cli_pull_opt_ignore_timestamps: If specified, pull artifacts whether or not they have been modified since the last successful pull or push command.
cli_pull_opt_all: If specified, pull all types of authoring artifacts.
cli_pull_opt_dir: Local working directory for storing files pulled from the Watson Content Hub authoring services.
cli_pull_content_pull_error: Pulling content with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_type_pull_error: Pulling content type with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_cat_pull_error: Pulling category with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_asset_pull_error: Pulling asset with path %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_resource_pull_error: Pulling resource with id %(id)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_layout_pull_error: Pulling layout with path %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_layout_mapping_pull_error: Pulling layout mapping with path %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_profile_pull_error: Pulling publishing profile with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_site_revision_pulled: Pulled publishing site revision with id %(name)s
cli_pull_site_revision_pull_error: Pulling publishing site revision with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_source_pull_error: Pulling publishing source with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_site_pull_error: Pulling site with name %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_page_pull_error: Pulling page with path %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_rendition_pull_error: Pulling rendition with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_image_profile_pull_error: Pulling image profile with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_pull_asset_digest_mismatch: Pulled asset %(asset)s digest does not match server digest.
cli_push_complete_nothing_pushed: No items pushed, nothing has been modified locally since the last successful push or pull command.  Use the -I option to ignore timestamps, if you want to push both modified and unmodified artifacts
cli_push_complete_ignore_timestamps_noth: No items to be pushed, push complete.
cli_push_no_directories_exist: The path specified does not contain any directories or items to be pushed. Verify the path being used.
cli_push_pushing_pages: Pushing page definitions for the specified site
cli_push_description: Push modified authoring artifacts to the IBM Watson Content Hub. If no artifact types are specified, web assets will be pushed by default.
cli_push_opt_types: If specified, content types will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_assets: If specified, content assets will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_web_assets: If specified, web application assets will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_layouts: If specified, layouts will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_layout_mappings: If specified, layout mappings will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_image_profiles: If specified, image profiles will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_content: If specified, content will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_categories: If specified, categories and taxonomies will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_renditions: If specified, renditions will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_profiles: If specified, publishing profiles will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_site_revisions: If specified, publishing site revisions will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_sources: If specified, publishing sources will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_sites: If specified, site definitions will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_pages: If specified, page definitions for the specified site will be pushed
cli_push_opt_ignore_timestamps: If specified, pushes artifacts whether or not they have been modified since the last successful pull or push command.
cli_push_opt_all: If specified, push all types of authoring artifacts.
cli_push_opt_dir: Local working directory for storing files to be pushed to the Watson Content Hub authoring services.
cli_push_opt_path: If specified, only web assets that are in this relative path will be pushed.  For example, if mySPA/ is specified, all web assets under the mySPA folder would be pushed.  If mySPA/css/ is specified, only web assets under the mySPA/css/ folder will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_named: If specified, only the item of the requested type with this name will be pushed.
cli_push_opt_force_override: If specified, force an override of revision conflicts, when pushing authoring artifacts. This option is ignored for publishing artifacts, which don't allow override of revision conflicts.
cli_push_asset_push_error: Pushing asset with path %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_resource_push_error: Pushing resource with path %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_content_push_error: Pushing content with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_type_push_error: Pushing content type with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_cat_push_error: Pushing category with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_image_profile_push_error: Pushing image profile with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_layout_push_error: Pushing layout with path %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_layout_mapping_push_error: Pushing layout mapping with path %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_rendition_push_error: Pushing rendition with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_site_push_error: Pushing site with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_page_push_error: Pushing page with path %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_profile_push_error: Pushing publishing profile with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_source_push_error: Pushing publishing source with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_push_name_and_ignore_timestamps: Invalid options named and Ignore-timestamps cannot be used together.
cli_push_name_and_path: Invalid options named and path cannot be used together.
cli_push_name_one_type: Invalid options, named can only be used for a single type.
cli_push_site_revision_pushed: Pushed publishing site revision with id %(name)s
cli_push_site_revision_push_error: Pushing publishing site revision with id %(name)s resulted in the following error: %(message)s.
cli_listing_pages: Listing page definitions for the specified site
cli_list_description: List local artifacts modified since they were pulled from or pushed to the server. If no artifact types are specified, web assets will be listed by default.
cli_list_opt_types: If specified, content types will be listed.
cli_list_opt_assets: If specified, assets will be listed.
cli_list_opt_web_assets: If specified, web assets will be listed.
cli_list_opt_layouts: If specified, layouts will be listed.
cli_list_opt_layout_mappings: If specified, layout mappings will be listed.
cli_list_opt_image_profiles: If specified, image profiles will be listed.
cli_list_opt_content: If specified, content will be listed.
cli_list_opt_categories: If specified, categories will be listed.
cli_list_opt_renditions: If specified, renditions will be listed.
cli_list_opt_profiles: If specified, publishing profiles will be listed.
cli_list_opt_site_revisions: If specified, publishing site revisions will be listed.
cli_list_opt_sources: If specified, publishing sources will be listed.
cli_list_opt_sites: If specified, site definitions will be listed.
cli_list_opt_pages: If specified, page definitions for the specified site will be listed.
cli_list_opt_all: If specified, list all types of authoring artifacts.
cli_list_opt_path: If specified, only web assets that are in this relative path will be listed.  For example, if mySPA/ is specified, only web assets under the mySPA folder would be listed.  If mySPA/css/ is specified, only web assets under the mySPA/css/ folder will be listed.
cli_list_opt_ignore_timestamps: If specified, all local artifacts will be listed whether or not they have been modified since the last successful push or pull command.
cli_list_opt_new: If specified, new local artifacts will be listed
cli_list_opt_deleted: If specified, deleted local artifacts will be listed
cli_list_opt_modified: If specified, modified local artifacts will be listed.  This is the default option if no other status option, such as new or deleted, is specified.
cli_list_opt_server: If specified, artifacts will be listed based on whether they have been modified or deleted on the server since the last successful push or pull command.
cli_rendering_description: Create a new publishing job that only renders existing published content, without explicitly publishing content or assets at this time.
cli_publishing_description: Create a new publishing job with default publishing source and profile.
cli_publishing_opt_rebuild: Use rebuild mode, to erase and rebuild an existing published revision. If not specified, publishing will default to update mode.
cli_publishing_opt_status: Display status for the specified publishing job
cli_publishing_job_error: Publishing job request resulted in an error: %(message)s
cli_publishing_site_revision_error: Unable to retrieve the publishing site revision. %(message)s
cli_delete_description: Delete the specified artifact(s) from Watson Content Hub.  Currently this command is limited to layouts, layout mappings and web assets such as html, css and javascript.  Use the authoring UI to delete other artifact types.  Only remote artifacts will be deleted.  Use local operating system commands to delete artifacts from the file system after deleting them from Watson Content Hub.
cli_delete_opt_web_assets: If specified, web assets will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_layouts: If specified, layouts will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_layout_mappings: If specified, layout mappings will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_id: The id of the artifact to be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_path: The path to the artifact(s) to be deleted. To specify that a folder should be deleted, you must also specify -r or --recursive
cli_delete_opt_recursive: If specified, the path argument will be treated as a folder, and all artifacts within that folder will be deleted.
cli_delete_opt_preview: If specified, list the artifact(s) that would be deleted, but do not actually delete the artifact(s).
cli_delete_opt_quiet: If specified, do not confirm deletion. (When more than one artifact would be deleted, a confirmation is displayed for each one.)
cli_delete_only_one_type: Delete currently only supports deleting one artifact type at a time.
cli_delete_no_type: Delete currently only supports deleting a web asset, layout or layout mapping, so -w, --webassets, -l, --layouts, -m or --layout-mappings must be specified.
cli_delete_by_id_not_supported: The --id argument is not supported for the specified artifact type.
cli_delete_by_path_not_supported: The --path argument is not supported for the specified artifact type.
cli_delete_recursive_not_supported: The --recursive argument is not supported for the specified artifact type.
cli_delete_no_match: There are no artifacts that match the specified path.
cli_delete_preview: The following artifacts match the specified path.
cli_deleting_web_assets: Deleting the web assets which match: %(path)s
cli_delete_error: There was an error deleting artifacts: %(err)s
cli_init_opt_user_name: The user name to be saved in the configuration settings.
cli_init_opt_url: The API URL specific to your %(product_name)s tenant. You can find this URL in the hub information dialog of the %(product_name)s authoring user interface.
cli_init_opt_dir: If specified, the location where the configuration settings will be saved. If not specified, the configuration settings will be saved in the user's home directory.
cli_init_success: The configuration settings were saved to %(path)s
cli_log_non_verbose: See wchtools-cli.log for more information on the operation.
